author: dlr
msg: Added definitions for and substitution of the JDK and JAVAC
preprocessor tokens.  These tokens will be used to build the Java
interfaces which will define Subversion's Java API.

author: dlr
msg: Added a note about the status of the SWIG Java bindings.

author: dlr
msg: Added note about Java's lack of bundled base-64.  Spoke a bit more
about SWIG modules.  Added a note about the definition of "thunk"
(for those not familiar with its win32 vintage).

author: dlr
msg: Removed the draft comment from the beginning of the file.  It's
really still a draft, but isn't everything?

author: mbk
msg: "When loading into a repository at revision 0, you almost
always want to update to the UUID from the dumpfile.  But when loading
into a repository that already *has* data, you probably don't want to
So, maybe that conditional should be the default behavior, and we
would instead have two options: one to force using the uuid, and one
This change implements those functional requirements.  The new option is
(cmd_table): update entry for "load" to include svnadmin__force_uuid
and documentation to replace the "ignore_uuid" boolean with an
(uuid_record): only set the repository UUID when appropriate.
"uuid_action", and pass it on to svn_repos_get_fs_build_parser().
